alert.note: Alert for Greene; Pickens; Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 16 at 7:15PM CST until January 18 at 9:00AM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Alabama... Tombigbee River At Bevill Lock and Dam affecting Greene, Pickens and Sumter Counties. .Flooding is forecast along the Tombigbee River at Bevill Lock and Dam, a Flood Warning remains in effect. Another statement will be issued by Monday morning, or sooner if conditions warrant. && ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON TO LATE TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tombigbee River At Bevill Lock and Dam. * WHEN...From Monday afternoon to late Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 122.0 feet, Cattle in low-lying areas of Southern Pickens County should be moved to higher ground. Cattle are cutoff in lowlands of Southern Pickens County at stages above 122 feet. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 PM CST Sunday the stage was 119.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 122.1 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 122.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
